item.title: Griffin add a quote by Stanislaw Lem
item.description:
"Have it compose a poem- a poem about a haircut! But lofty, tragic, timeless, full of love, treachery, retribution, quiet heroism in the face of certain doom! Six lines, cleverly rhymed, and every word beginning with the letter S!!” [sic]…. Seduced, shaggy Samson snored. She scissored short. Sorely shorn, Soon shackled slave, Samson sighed, Silently scheming Sightlessly seeking Some savage, spectacular suicide."
("The First Sally (A) or The Electronic Bard" THE CYBERIAD)" -- Stanislaw Lem

item.title: Griffin add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "…the extent to which a society focuses on the needs of its lowest common denominator is the extent to which that society’ll be mired in mediocrity. Whereas, if we would aim the bulk of our support at the brightest, most talented, most virtuous instead, then they would have the wherewithal to solve a lot of our problems, to uplift the whole culture, enlighten it or something, so that eventually there wouldn’t be so many losers and weaklings impeding evolution and dragging the whole species down…. Martyrs…just perpetuate human misery by catering to it…. Individuals have to take responsibility for their own lives and accept the consequences of their choices." -- Tom Robbins

item.title: Griffin add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "FOR EVERY STOIC WAS A STOIC BUT WHERE IN CHRISTENDOM IS THE CHRISTIAN?" -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Griffin add a quote by Titus Maccius Plautus
item.description: "He whom the Gods love dies young." -- Titus Maccius Plautus

item.title: Griffin add a quote by Tom Robbins (Author)
Griffin add a quote by Hermann Finsterlin
item.description:
"Such cathedrals are only built by heart[s] in monstrous despair or … Dionysian ecstasy,… only a Superman is capable of such creative despair.”
On Gaudi’s Familia Segrada" -- Hermann Finsterlin

item.title: Griffin add a quote by Hermann Finsterlin
item.description:
"And a youth said, Speak to us of Friendship. And he answered, saying: Your friend is your needs answered. He is your field which you sow with love and reap with Thanksgiving. And he is your board and your fireside. For you come to him with your hunger, And you seek him for peace.
The Prophet" -- Hermann Finsterlin

item.title: Griffin add a quote by Tom Robbins
Griffin add a quote by Erasmus
item.description: "Given a choice between a folly and a sacrament, one should always choose the folly—because we know a sacrament will not bring us closer to god and there’s always the chance that a folly will." -- Erasmus

item.title: Griffin add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Some scientists claim that hydrogen, because it is so plentiful, is the basic building block of the universe. I dispute that. I say there is more stupidity than hydrogen, and that is the basic building block of the universe." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Griffin add a quote by Origami Boulder Artist
item.description: "stupid idea well developed better than best idea never used" -- Origami Boulder Artist

item.title: Griffin add a quote by John Nichols
item.description:
"If the radical right had its way we’d all be church-going polyester heterosexuals driving around in white Cadillacs eating meatloaf and wax beans while mammoth bulldozers leveled all our forests and even hummingbirds were extinct.”
Charley, The Voice of the Butterfly" -- John Nichols

item.title: Griffin add a quote by Sephie of "Meridian"
item.description: "Work is the greatest antidote for pain." -- Sephie of "Meridian"

item.title: Griffin add a quote by Nancy Farmer
item.description: "I am one for whom dangers are play- things One who empties men of their strength as a nut from its shell The charms you use I chop up for relish on my porridge Beware! I am a deadly mamba Wrestler of legends A hive of hornets A man among men" -- Nancy Farmer

item.title: Griffin add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The ships hung in the sky in much the same way that bricks don't." -- Douglas Adams
